Okay, so how am I supposed to search for Sagara when it's in Japanese???  :-D  Never mind that, is there a translator that will give the me the kanji to paste into the search field?  Once I can access anything they *might* have, then I can babelfish (and then BEG for a translation to restore some of my lost sanity).
 
phil (who feels like she's just been brought in to be tortured... give me a site of newspaper archives and NO way to search...  that's cruel M... really cruel  :-D)

Hirotada Tokugawa <patriot014@...> wrote:
You guys!! I can't believe I found this!

http://cork.wul.waseda.ac.jp/kosho/

Seems to be run by Waseda University-- a HUGE archive of newspapers and 
prints relating to the late Edo/Bakumatsu and early Meiji periods!

In particular, this section of the archive:

http://cork.wul.waseda.ac.jp/kosho/bunko10

Has info on Seinan War/Saigou Takamori, starting from b10_8328 to b10_8338. 
My favorite is 
http://cork.wul.waseda.ac.jp/kosho/bunko10/b10_8336/b10_8336.jpg, a picture 
of two of the samurai women of Satsuma, armed with naginata and short 
swords.

--M.
